page.title: 15Farming(3)
page.content: Early potatoes are ready in June.We get these up as early as they are needed. Main Crop potatoes are harvested in October. they are stored all winter in frost-free buildings. Until recently we kept them in "Clamps".These were hollow trenches covered with straw and soil to protect the potoatoes from the weather. The soil on our farm is "moos" soil which is very rich, black and fertile. The area used to be forest many thousands of years ago and now the ploughs sometimes hit a "moos stock". This is a tree trunk which is almost fossilised. It has to be dug up and dragged out of the ground by tractor. (Martin Bond)
